### gcd(e,phi) > 1

---

When e and phi are not co prime, we will not have a unique `d` and hence, no unique solution. We need to find all the solutions and check for our required flag or plaintext.

```sage
n = 
e = 16
ct = 
Z.<X> = GF(n)[]
P = X^e - ct
# Discard the y coordinate, always 1
for r, _ in P.roots():
    h = hex(r)[2:]
    if b'crypto'.hex() in h:
        print(bytes.fromhex(h))
```
